A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm not going to write up a huge\, spoiler infested post combating all the negative hype. I would love to\, but you know what? I'm enjoying the glow of a movie well enjoyed. 
Does it have plot holes? Yes. Though some plot holes that people have so vehemently complained about are explained either subtly or rather overtly in the last act.Does it suffer from tech blunders and tech flux? Oh yes. But what Star Wars movie hasn't? 
What this movie has in spades is great storytelling\, the wonder of the force\, the struggle of light against dark\, hope against hopelessness\, rebellion against oppression. The character development is strong\, and the big side quest that everyone complains about being pointless is great because it seems that way\, and yet\, in the very last frame\, you see the point it had. The connection the force made. Not only that\, the fact that the harebrained scheme DIDN'T work for once\, is wonderful. 
I went in expecting the worst because of the reviews\, and came out baffled as to why people were so upset. This is the Star Wars of my childhood. And just like Force Awakens\, I love it for it.
